title: Introducing: Babble
body:
‘Folk’ music has always been a tricky one for me.

I love Bright Eyes, Elliott Smith and Sufjan, but find there’s a very fine line between emotional fragility and vapid, self-indulgence. Thankfully, this debut release from Amanda Goodman, aka **Babble**, certainly comes in on the right side. **_Until My Lips Fall Off_** is ten tracks of touching, ever-so-slightly raw, acoustic gorgeousness, mixing elements of Sharon Van Etten and Bill Callahan amidst her fraught, tender songwriting. Truly, this is a beautiful release. Check out a couple of highlights below and grab UMLFO over at her [Bandcamp](https://b-a-b-b-l-e.bandcamp.com/).

“tell me how the sun tastes,  
tell her that i miss her warm skin against my face”

Like this? Follow our [On Repeat Playlist](https://open.spotify.com/user/crackintheroad/playlist/1UB6gJIZpmiO0H2zmSbg02) for a handpicked selection of the very best in new music; updated weekly.
